data.title: Lost in the White City (2014)
data.meta_description: The White City tells the story of an emotionally charged love triangle set in the hot political climate of modern Tel Aviv. A young couple take a winter break in Tel Aviv as an opportunity to exercise their creativity. But while Eva writes poetry and parties with friends, Kyle works on a film which expresses his own confused sexuality with Avi, a young ex-soldier; drawing Avi further into the couple’s complex relationship. The White City presents a new slant on the love triangle genre, with the backdrop of Tel Aviv as a cultural counterpoint to the American couple’s life. Cambridge Film Festival 2014 (http://www.cambridgefilmfestival.org.uk/films/2014/the-white-city)
data.text: I screened this for a film class, and it was an early director's cut. The title card at the beginning of the film read "Lost in the White City," which is not what IMDb says, so we'll have to see what they settle on. Basically, it's the story of a couple, and aspiring artists, dicking around in Tel Aviv. The guy is a filmmaker, hoping to make a film that blurs the lines between documentary and fiction (or some shit like that), and the girl is a poet, or a writer, or something. Their relationship is strained, and the guy falls in love with this (male) actor who is in his film. And the girl eventually fucks him. Commentary about…
